rawsock

Description

UNIX raw socket access

Author

Elf

Author

Ben Kurtz

Requires

  • srfi-66

Version

  • 1.0 Initial release by Ben Kurtz
  • 2.0 Refactored and cleaned by Elf
  • 2.1 Added non-blocking read by Elf

Usage

(require-extension rawsock)

Download

rawsock.egg

Documentation

This egg provides the ability to open packet sockets, close packet sockets, and perform non-blocking read and write operations.

Packet sockets are even less cooked than "raw" sockets, letting you set layer 2 fields manually.

Currently, this egg has only been ported to OSX and Linux.

Future Work: port to Win32 and other targets.

procedure: (open-raw-socket INTERFACE)

Opens a packet socket on the given interface name.

procedure: (raw-send RAWSOCK BUFFER)

Sends a buffer of bytes out the opened socket. RAWSOCK is the socket returned by open-raw-socket. BUFFER is the u8vector containing the data to be sent.

procedure: (raw-recv RAWSOCK)

Receives data on RAWSOCK. Returns a pair of (number-of-bytes . u8vector-with-data).

procedure: (close-raw-socket RAWSOCK)

Closes the given packet socket.
